original_title: Sri Lanka bond yields steady at open, rupee at 319.70/320 against the US dollar
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s bond yields were steady at open on Wednesday as results of a bill auction is awaited, while the rupee opened up at319.70/320 against the US dollar in the spot market, dealers said.
A bond maturing on 01.07.2025 was quoted at 29.25/75 percent unchanged from the last close.
A bond maturing on 01.05.2027 was quoted at 27.20/50 percent, steady from 27.25/75 percent, on Tuesday’s close.
The rupee opened at 319.70/320 against the US dollar in the spot market appreciated from the last close at 320.30/70. (Colombo/May03/2023)
